data.name: AppInfo
data.value:
マイクロソフトのPC正常性チェックアプリ(現在取り下げ中)の代替品
このプロジェクトは https://github.com/mag-nif-i-cent/Affinity11 からフォークしています
作者への連絡は \ttwitter.com/builtbybel
(C) 2021, Builtbybel

data.name: hoveCPUInfo
data.value: Your CPU meets the soft requirements, it's just not listed on the offical list of supported processors.

data.name: hoverAssetInfo
data.value: @github.com/builtbybel/readysunvalley を開く

data.name: hoverBootBad
data.value: Your system needs to support a UEFI boot mode, right now your system is booting using Legacy. This doesn't necessarily mean that your system doesn't support it. Check your motherboard, system manual or BIOS for more information.

data.name: hoverCPUBad
data.value: Your CPU doesn't meet the specification requirements, see individual info about frequency or cores below.

data.name: hoverCPUCoresBad
data.value: Windows 11の実行に十分なCPUコア数がありません

data.name: hoverCPUSpeedBad
data.value: CPU周波数がWindows 11の最低要件を満たしません

data.name: hoverDiectXBad
data.value: Your DirectX version is too low. This doesn't necessarily mean that your system doesn't support higher versions. Check DXDIAG for more information.

data.name: hoverDisplayBad
data.value: 1つ以上のモニターがWindows 11の動作には狭すぎます

data.name: hoverFreeSpaceBad
data.value: From the leaked version of Windows 11, It can be seen that the Setup file (ISO File) size is 4.54 GB. Considering that the leaked version does not have all the features, we can say that the actual file size will be between 4.5 to 6 GB. Just keep in mind that Windows 11 requires a disk with at least 64 GB of storage space.

data.name: hoverInetBad
data.value: Windows 11 Home edition requires internet connectivity and a Microsoft account to complete device setup on first use. Switching a device out of Windows 11 Home in S mode also requires internet connectivity.

data.name: hoverPartitionBad
data.value: Your system needs to support GPT partition types, right now your system is booting using MBR. This doesn't necessarily mean that your system doesn't support it. Check your motherboard, system manual or bios for more information.

data.name: hoverRAMBad
data.value: RAM容量がWindows 11の最低要件を満たしません

data.name: hoverRecheck
data.value: チェックを再度実行

data.name: hoverSecureBootBad
data.value: Secure Boot functionality is missing. You can bypass the Secure boot requirements with ReadySunValley. Use the repair link in the right panel.

data.name: hoverStorageBad
data.value: Windows 11の実行に十分な容量がありません

data.name: hoverTPMBad
data.value: If no TPM is present, you’ll probably find it’s been disabled in the UEFI.

data.name: hoverTPMInfo
data.value: Your TPM version is too low. If you’re running an older version of TPM (1.2 typically), then you may be able to update it to TPM 2.0 with a firmware update.

data.name: hoverWDDMBad
data.value: Your Windows Display Driver Model version does not meet the minimum requirements for Windows 11.

data.name: infoBypassDone
data.value: TPM and Secure Boot restriction has been bypassed.

data.name: infoBypassUndo
data.value: System setttings are in place again.

data.value: 結果の画像をTwitterにアップロードすることを忘れずに

data.name: menuBypassUndo
data.value: Undo Bypass

data.name: menuVote
data.value: Vote here!

data.name: menuVoteContent
data.value: Does your hardware qualify for Windows 11?

data.name: optionBypass
data.value:
If you are attempting to install Windows 11 and receive a message stating, "This PC can't run Windows 11" it is likely that you do not have a TPM 2.0 requirement, Secure Boot or 4GB of RAM.

The good news is that Microsoft includes a new "LabConfig" registry key that allows you to configure settings to bypass the TPM 2.0, the 4GB memory, and Secure Boot requirements.

Please note, that by disabling the TPM 2.0 requirement, you are effectively reducing the security in Windows 11

Do you want to bypass these restrictions?

data.name: updateTitle
data.value: アプリの更新が利用可能
